Skipton, Extension Educator Wayne Woldt, Extension Environmental Engineering Specialist Sources of Iron and Manganese in Drinking Water Indications of Iron and Manganese Potential Health Effects Testing Interpreting Test Results Options Summary Iron and manganese are nonhazardous elements that can be a nuisance in a water supply. They are similar metals and cause similar problems. Of the two, iron is found most frequently in water supplies. Manganese is often found in waters that contain... [cached version]

snippet.title: Iron Water Treatment Solutions and Iron Water Filtration
snippet.description: * Iron Water Treatment Solutions and Iron Water Filtration (clueweb12-0707wb-86-09814) http://www.waterfilters.net/Iron-Water-Treatment.html Iron Water Treatment Solutions and Iron Water Filtration ...reddish color when it is exposed to oxygen after it leaves a well or other water source. When dissolved iron comes from a well, it reaches your plumbing system and becomes oxidized in particulate (nondissolved) iron. At this point, the water may become slightly yellow or red or the water supply lines may become stained. To determine whether you have a Tannins or Iron problem with your water, you will need to test your water. You can do a... [cached version]
